title: Apple has 'trillions' in demand for THIS product, but research founder warns the problem
text: Constellation Research founder R 'Ray' Wang addresses NVIDIA's CEO hoping to sell to China and discusses the earnings outlook for various tech companies on 'The Claman Countdown.' #fox #media #breakingnews #us #usa #new #news #breaking #foxbusiness #theclamancountdown #raywang #nvidia #apple #china #tech #technology #stocks #market #finance #business #economy #earnings #investing #ai #innovation #global #siliconvalley #ceo #research

title: How Tim Cook Evaded Disaster at Apple This Year
text: The CEO was facing risks from Trump's tariffs, Google litigation and the AI craze. He turned to his playbook and now the iPhone maker is worth $4 trillion.

title: Big Tech earnings recap: Meta, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, and Alphabet
text: Big Tech companies including Meta, Microsoft, Alphabet, Apple, and Amazon all reported their quarterly earnings this past week. We speak to Wall Street insiders to analyze the results, key themes for investors including Ai capex spending, the outlook for growth, and opportunities for investors.

title: Buffett Cut His Apple Stake In Q2, But He's Still Up A Cool $16 Billion Since Then
text: Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL) is the largest stock in the Berkshire Hathaway Inc (NYSE:BRK) (NYSE:BRK) investment portfolio. While the conglomerate, led by legendary investor Warren Buffett, has been cutting its stake in the tech giant, the position has soared in value since the end of the second quarter.

title: 5 Magnificent Seven Firms Reported Earnings This Week
text: Five of the so-called “Magnificent Seven” firms reported earnings this week in a major milestone for 2025's economic narrative. Apple (AAPL), Amazon (AMZN), Microsoft (MSFT), Google (GOOGL), and Meta (META) all shared their earnings, offering some important insights into key tech firms amid the AI revolution.

title: Apple Predicts Strong iPhone Sales, As AI Concerns Linger
text: Apple reported a bump in quarterly sales and predicted the holiday season would be its “best iPhone quarter ever.” But concerns around China and AI persist.

title: Dan Ives on AAPL & GOOGL "One-Two Punch," PLTR Potential, A.I. "Goldilocks Scenario"
text: Wedbush's Dan Ives returns to The Watch List and reiterates that the A.I. trade will continue a bullish run for the foreseeable future.

title: Meta, Amazon, Apple, Microsoft, Alphabet: Big Tech leads packed week of earnings
text: Oppenheimer & Co analysts late Thursday weighed in on Reddit (NYSE:RDDT)'s third quarter earnings and revenue results, which exceeded Wall Street expectations.

title: Apple Q4 Earnings Beat Estimates, Services Drive Top-Line Growth
text: AAPL's fiscal Q4 earnings surge on strong iPhone and Mac demand, with services up 15% and upbeat Q1 guidance fueling momentum.

title: Apple's earnings standout is the sizable upside to December quarter, says Evercore's Amit Daryanani
text: Amit Daryanani, Evercore ISI, joins 'The Exchange' to discuss Apple's quarterly earnings results, if Apple saw trepidation from budget-friendly customers and much more.

title: Wall Street Roundup: Is This Time Really Different?
text: The Fed's latest rate cut highlights internal division and ongoing tension between inflation concerns and signs of economic slowdown, especially in the labor market. Meta (META) reported strong earnings but faced investor skepticism over rising R&D and CapEx, contrasting with more disciplined spending at Alphabet (GOOGL) and Microsoft (MSFT).

title: Tony Wang: Earnings reinforce that AI continues to be the key investment for Mag 7
text: Tony Wang, T. Rowe Price science and technology fund manager, joins CNBC's 'Squawk on the Street' to discuss outlooks on earnings.

title: Needham's Laura Martin: Apple finally laid out AI strategy, even though it's four quarters late
text: Laura Martin, Needham senior internet and media analyst, joins CNBC's 'Money Movers' to discuss her reaction to tech earnings.

title: Hopeful "Wait and See" Story for AAPL in iPhone 17 Sales & China Momentum
text: Apple (AAPL) traded about flat after posting record revenue in earnings, though iPhone sales and China revenue both missed estimates from Wall Street. Ben Bajarin believes the report showed a strong foundation that Apple will build on with time.

title: Pre-market Traders Fill Their Bags on Halloween
text: The Nasdaq leads major indexes this morning, +350 points on strength in Amazon following Q3 earnings yesterday.

title: Amazon and Apple report earnings: Here's what to know
text: CNBC's MacKenzie Sigalos and Steve Kovach join 'Squawk on the Street' with the latest news earnings from Amazon and Apple.

title: Apple Experts Bullish After Q4—'Eventual Winner' In AI
text: Apple, Inc. (NASDAQ:AAPL) reported strong fourth-quarter results on Thursday, delivering record sales in both iPhone and Services and showing solid underlying demand.

title: Apple and Amazon show strong growth outlooks, Brooks Running CEO talks shoes and NYC Marathon
text: Yahoo Finance executive editor Brian Sozzi breaks down the latest market news for October 31, 2025. Apple and Amazon reported strong earnings reports.

title: Apple expects to finish the year with a monster quarter — and turn things around in China
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook predicted record revenue for the December quarter, driven by the iPhone 17. Despite revenue in China declining last quarter, Cook said he expected a rebound to growth in the region.

title: Tim Cook says Apple is open to M&A on the AI front
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook signaled to investors the company is still open to acquisitions and partnerships to move things forward on the AI front.

title: Amazon's blowout quarter, Apple issues strong holiday outlook, Exxon and Chevron beat expectations
text: Morning Brief anchor Julie Hyman breaks down the latest market news for October 31, 2025. Amazon reported the fastest cloud unit growth in three years.

title: Apple's ‘impressive' December guidance speaks to strong iPhone 17 demand: analysts
text: Wedbush analysts raised their target price on Apple Inc (NASDAQ:AAPL, ETR:APC) to $320 per share from $310 to reflect what they called “increased confidence” in the Apple growth story.   The analysts also believe the iPhone 17 launch is “off to a great start” heading into the key holiday December quarter in the US and China and noted the company's continued strong Services growth.

title: Apple Intelligence Is Huge Opportunity, Munster Says
text: Deepwater Asset Management Managing Partner Gene Munster says iPhone demand will outpace estimates for the next three quarters and he says Apple Intelligence is going to be the "biggest step forward" for Apple since the iPhone itself. He speaks on "Bloomberg Surveillance.

title: Wall Street Loves Apple, Amazon and Nvidia
text: Coinbase (NASDAQ: COIN): Bernstein reiterated an outperform rating on Coinbase, noting that the crypto giant is firing on all cylinders.

title: Apple Will Do Deal With Google's Gemini, Ives Says
text: Dan Ives of Wedbush Securities says Apple has to focus more on the AI consumer revolution. He expects Apple will do a massive deal with Google's Gemini AI Assistant.

title: Apple Stock Is on a Roll. 2 Reasons It Can Keep Going Despite AI Worry.
text: The company's earnings reassured investors about both demand for iPhones and revenue from the services business.

title: Amazon and Apple Set the Pace
text: Key Takeaways

title: Should you buy Apple's stock after earnings? These analysts see better options.
text: Apple sees iPhone trends improving, but analysts note its stock is more expensive than other hardware and smartphone plays like Qualcomm and Alphabet.

title: Nasdaq Surges Over 1%; Apple Earnings Top Views
text: U.S. stocks traded higher this morning, with the Nasdaq Composite gaining more than 1% on Friday.

title: 5 Things to Know Before the Stock Market Opens
text: Stock futures are on the rise, with tech stocks leading the way after strong earnings reports from tech titans Apple and Amazon. Amazon is set to open at a record high after reporting cloud growth accelerated last quarter; Apple topped quarterly estimates and forecast record holiday-quarter revenue; Reddit shares are jumping on its earnings beat and solid forecast; and Netflix stock is rising higher after the streaming giant announced its first stock split in a decade.

title: AAPL & AMZN Push SPX Higher, NFLX 10-for-1 Stock Split & SNAP Benefits Ending
text: "What a difference a day makes," says Kevin Hincks, noting Apple (AAPL) and Amazon (AMZN) earnings reversing much of Thursday's down action in Friday's premarket. One signal of trouble ahead: SNAP benefits ending on November 1st as the U.S. government shutdown enters day 31.

title: Apple Is Failing in China
text: Apple Inc. (NASDAQ: AAPL) just posted excellent quarterly results.

title: Nvidia strikes deal with South Korea to supply AI chips, Apple and Amazon report strong earnings
text: Morning Brief: Market Sunrise host Allie Canal breaks down the latest market news for October 31, 2025. Nvidia announced a deal with the South Korean government and companies to supply hundreds of thousands of AI chips as the country accelerates its push for AI.

title: Apple stock rises as iPhone 17 sales drive record holiday forecast, analysts upbeat
text: Apple shares rose nearly 2% in premarket trading on Friday after the company forecast record sales for the key holiday quarter, driven by robust demand for its new iPhone 17 lineup despite supply constraints and sluggish performance in China.

title: BofA's Wamsi Mohan breaks down Apple's Q4 results
text: Wamsi Mohan, Bank of American Securities analyst, joins 'Squawk Box' to break down Apple's quarterly earnings results.

title: Tim Cook Reveals Apple's Ad Business Quietly Set A Record — While Everyone Looked At iPhones
text: While analysts peppered Tim Cook with questions about the iPhone 17's flying design and China's demand revival on Thursday, one of Apple Inc's (NASDAQ:AAPL) biggest wins this quarter slipped almost unnoticed: advertising.

title: Wall Street Breakfast Podcast: Nasdaq Climbs On Tech Wins
text: Amazon (AMZN) surges 12% premarket after beating Q3 estimates, with AWS revenue up 20% and strong subscription growth. Apple (AAPL) rises 2% post-earnings, projecting 10–12% FQ1 revenue growth and promising AI-enhanced Siri rollout next year.

title: Amazon, Apple Were the Mag 7 Losers. Here's Why That's About to Change.
text: Apple is betting on a big holiday season, Netflix weighs Warner Bros. bid, Pfizer and Novo Nordisk find themselves in a bidding war, and more news to start your day.

title: Apple shares rise as iPhone holiday sales forecast soothes supply woes
text: Apple shares rose about 2% premarket on Friday after upbeat forecasts for the lucrative holiday quarter suggested the latest iPhone 17 models were driving a sales rebound despite delays in shipping to key market China.

title: Stock Market Today: S&P 500 Futures Rise, Bolstered by Apple, Amazon Rally
text: Investors cheer earnings from Apple and Amazon

title: Amazon pops, Apple steadies: What after-hours results say about Big Tech in an AI-jittery market
text: Two of the market's bellwethers released their numbers after the closing bell, and the message to anyone with exposure via SIPPs, ISAs or tech-heavy pensions was clear: cash flows from cloud and services are doing the heavy lifting even as the AI euphoria invites bubble chatter. Amazon.com Inc's (NASDAQ:AMZN) shares leapt around 10% to 13% in late trading after a strong beat, led by a sharp re-acceleration at Amazon Web Services, where sales rose 20% year on year to $33 billion, the fastest pace in nearly three years.
